title_sort: walt whitman to richard maurice bucke, 17 july 1888
title: Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 17 July 1888
text: CamdenTuesday Early PMJuly 17 '88Pleasant weather warmish but not hot—my body strength & head grip low ebb still—not much different—no going ahead & no serious ebb—a bad day yesterday, brain thick & body sluggish—but to-day quite a movement bowel quite decided—used (instigated) (by a little syringe a little longer than your small finger) a small injection of glycerine—young Dr. Mitchell suggested it yesterday afternoon—I feel better I suppose as I sit here, but my head is thick yet— A good letter from John Burroughs this morning—all as usual with him—(a dear friend personal & literary)—2 o'clock P M—a good letter from you wh' I will read a second time—I turn around & eat a couple of nice California pears. I send you pp 82 to 92 inclusive proof sheets, those are all the printers given me to date—I am still sitting up—have my dinner ab't 5—(now after 3 & I got up ab't 10½)—am middling comfortable—quiet afternoon—Shall lie down on the bed—generally fair spirits—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to Richard Maurice Bucke, 17 July 1888
